subtopics.title: Cell structure
content: Eukaryotic cells (animal and plant) have a cell membrane, cytoplasm and genetic material enclosed in a nucleus
Plant and algal cells also have a cell wall, chloroplasts and vacuoles
Bacteria are prokaryotic cells, much smaller than eukaryotic cells
Bacterial cells have a cell wall, cell membrane, cytoplasm and circular DNA, but no nucleus
DNA is genetic material that determines cell function and characteristics
Mitochondria are sites of aerobic respiration
Chloroplasts are sites of photosynthesis
Cell wall is made of cellulose in plants
Vacuoles contain cell sap in plant cells
required_skills: Use microscopes to observe and draw cells
Calculate magnification and cell size
Label diagrams of animal and plant cells
Explain differences between animal and plant cells
Explain differences between eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells
(HT only) Explain how cell structures are related to their functions
mathematical_skills: Calculate actual size from magnified images

subtopics.title: Cell division
content: Cells divide by mitosis during growth and repair
Mitosis produces two identical daughter cells
Before mitosis, DNA replicates and copies are made
During mitosis chromosomes line up and separate
Cell cycle includes growth, DNA synthesis, and mitosis
Stem cells are undifferentiated cells
Stem cells can differentiate into specialized cells
Therapeutic cloning uses stem cells to treat conditions
required_skills: Describe stages of mitosis
Explain importance of mitosis in growth and repair
Describe function of stem cells
Evaluate use of stem cells in medicine
(HT only) Explain process of cell differentiation
mathematical_skills: Calculate percentage change in cell numbers
Use standard form for very large/small numbers

subtopics.title: Principles of organisation
content: Cells are the basic building blocks of all living organisms
Cells form tissues, tissues form organs, organs form organ systems
Digestive system is an example of an organ system
Heart and blood vessels form the circulatory system
Organisational hierarchy: cells → tissues → organs → organ systems → organism
required_skills: Explain levels of organisation in living things
Describe functions of major organ systems
Link cell types to tissue function
Explain how organ systems work together
mathematical_skills: Calculate surface area to volume ratios

subtopics.title: Animal tissues, organs and organ systems
content: The heart is made of muscle tissue and pumps blood around body
Blood carries oxygen and nutrients to cells
Blood contains red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets and plasma
Blood vessels include arteries, veins and capillaries
Lungs are organs for gas exchange
Digestive system includes mouth, stomach, intestines, liver and pancreas
Enzymes help break down food molecules
required_skills: Identify different types of blood cells
Explain how enzymes work
Describe process of digestion
Calculate heart rate and stroke volume
(HT only) Calculate cardiac output
